channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: XTransplant: A Probe into the Upper Bound Performance of Multilingual Capability and Culture Adaptability in LLMs via Mutual Cross-lingual Feed-forward Transplantation
item.description: Through extensive pilot experiments, we empirically prove that both the multilingual capabilities and cultural adaptability of LLMs hold the potential to be significantly improved by XTransplant, respectively from En -> non-En and non-En -> En, highlighting the underutilization of current LLMs' multilingual potential.

item.title: ArchesWeather & ArchesWeatherGen: a deterministic and generative model for efficient ML weather forecasting
item.description: We then design a probabilistic weather model called \textbf{ArchesWeatherGen} based on flow matching, a modern variant of diffusion models, that is trained to project ArchesWeather's predictions to the distribution of ERA5 weather states.

item.title: RDPI: A Refine Diffusion Probability Generation Method for Spatiotemporal Data Imputation
item.description: In the initial stage, deterministic imputation methods are used to generate preliminary estimates of the missing data.

item.title: Addressing Small and Imbalanced Medical Image Datasets Using Generative Models: A Comparative Study of DDPM and PGGANs with Random and Greedy K Sampling
item.description: This study highlights the efficacy of DDPM in augmenting small, imbalanced medical image datasets, improving model performance by balancing the dataset and expanding its size.

item.title: Deep Learning Based Superconductivity: Prediction and Experimental Tests
item.description: With the help of hints from our network, we discover a new ternary compound $\textrm{Mo}_{20}\textrm{Re}_{6}\textrm{Si}_{4}$, which becomes superconducting below 5. 4 K. We further discuss the existing limitations and challenges associated with using AI to predict and, along with potential future research directions.

item.title: MedMax: Mixed-Modal Instruction Tuning for Training Biomedical Assistants
item.description: To address these gaps, we present MedMax, the first large-scale multimodal biomedical instruction-tuning dataset for mixed-modal foundation models.

item.title: SafeAgentBench: A Benchmark for Safe Task Planning of Embodied LLM Agents
item.description: With the integration of large language models (LLMs), embodied agents have strong capabilities to execute complicated instructions in natural language, paving a way for the potential deployment of embodied robots.

item.title: ZoRI: Towards Discriminative Zero-Shot Remote Sensing Instance Segmentation
item.description: Instance segmentation algorithms in remote sensing are typically based on conventional methods, limiting their application to seen scenarios and closed-set predictions.

item.title: RA-SGG: Retrieval-Augmented Scene Graph Generation Framework via Multi-Prototype Learning
item.description: Scene Graph Generation (SGG) research has suffered from two fundamental challenges: the long-tailed predicate distribution and semantic ambiguity between predicates.

item.title: Syntactic Transfer to Kyrgyz Using the Treebank Translation Method
item.description: The Kyrgyz language, as a low-resource language, requires significant effort to create high-quality syntactic corpora.

item.title: Boosting Long-Context Information Seeking via Query-Guided Activation Refilling
item.description: ACRE constructs a Bi-layer KV Cache for long contexts, where the layer-1 (L1) cache compactly captures global information, and the layer-2 (L2) cache provides detailed and localized information.

item.title: Train More Parameters But Mind Their Placement: Insights into Language Adaptation with PEFT
item.description: Smaller LLMs still face significant challenges even in medium-resourced languages, particularly when it comes to language-specific knowledge -- a problem not easily resolved with machine-translated data.

item.title: AutoSGNN: Automatic Propagation Mechanism Discovery for Spectral Graph Neural Networks
item.description: This challenge has led to the manual design of GNNs tailored to specific graph types, but these approaches are limited by the high cost of labor and the constraints of expert knowledge, which cannot keep up with the rapid growth of graph data.

item.title: Can You Trust LLM Judgments? Reliability of LLM-as-a-Judge
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have become increasingly powerful and ubiquitous, but their stochastic nature poses challenges to the reliability of their outputs.

item.title: Unlocking LLMs: Addressing Scarce Data and Bias Challenges in Mental Health
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have shown promising capabilities in healthcare analysis but face several challenges like hallucinations, parroting, and bias manifestation.

item.title: Benchmarking and Understanding Compositional Relational Reasoning of LLMs
item.description: Compositional relational reasoning (CRR) is a hallmark of human intelligence, but we lack a clear understanding of whether and how existing transformer large language models (LLMs) can solve CRR tasks.

item.title: Token-Level Graphs for Short Text Classification
item.description: The classification of short texts is a common subtask in Information Retrieval (IR).

item.title: A Method for Enhancing Generalization of Adam by Multiple Integrations
item.description: The insufficient generalization of adaptive moment estimation (Adam) has hindered its broader application.

item.title: Efficient Diffusion Transformer Policies with Mixture of Expert Denoisers for Multitask Learning
item.description: Furthermore, we conduct comprehensive ablations on MoDE's components, providing insights for designing efficient and scalable Transformer architectures for Diffusion Policies.

item.title: Adaptations of AI models for querying the LandMatrix database in natural language
item.description: The Land Matrix initiative (https://landmatrix. org) and its global observatory aim to provide reliable data on large-scale land acquisitions to inform debates and actions in sectors such as agriculture, extraction, or energy in low- and middle-income countries.

item.title: DuSSS: Dual Semantic Similarity-Supervised Vision-Language Model for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Vision-Language Model (VLM) has great potential to enhance pseudo labels by introducing text prompt guided multimodal supervision information.

item.title: Predicting Change, Not States: An Alternate Framework for Neural PDE Surrogates
item.description: Neural surrogates for partial differential equations (PDEs) have become popular due to their potential to quickly simulate physics.

item.title: Preference-Oriented Supervised Fine-Tuning: Favoring Target Model Over Aligned Large Language Models
item.description: Alignment, endowing a pre-trained Large language model (LLM) with the ability to follow instructions, is crucial for its real-world applications.

item.title: Practicable Black-box Evasion Attacks on Link Prediction in Dynamic Graphs -- A Graph Sequential Embedding Method
item.description: In this paper, we propose the first practicable black-box evasion attack method that achieves effective attacks against the target LPDG model, within a limited amount of interactions and perturbations.

item.title: Unleashing the Potential of Model Bias for Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: The primary challenges stem from model bias induced by pre-training on only known categories and the lack of precise supervision for novel ones, leading to category bias towards known categories and category confusion among different novel categories, which hinders models' ability to identify novel categories effectively.

item.title: Quantifying Lexical Semantic Shift via Unbalanced Optimal Transport
item.description: Lexical semantic change detection aims to identify shifts in word meanings over time.

item.title: Unsupervised UAV 3D Trajectories Estimation with Sparse Point Clouds
item.description: Compact UAV systems, while advancing delivery and surveillance, pose significant security challenges due to their small size, which hinders detection by traditional methods.

item.title: PerSphere: A Comprehensive Framework for Multi-Faceted Perspective Retrieval and Summarization
item.description: As online platforms and recommendation algorithms evolve, people are increasingly trapped in echo chambers, leading to biased understandings of various issues.

item.title: Are Your LLMs Capable of Stable Reasoning?
item.description: The rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has demonstrated remarkable progress in complex reasoning tasks.

item.title: EventFull: Complete and Consistent Event Relation Annotation
item.description: Event relation detection is a fundamental NLP task, leveraged in many downstream applications, whose modeling requires datasets annotated with event relations of various types.

item.title: Human-in-the-Loop Generation of Adversarial Texts: A Case Study on Tibetan Script
item.description: How do we generate adversarial texts for less-studied languages?

item.title: Queries, Representation & Detection: The Next 100 Model Fingerprinting Schemes
item.description: To foster the creation of new fingerprinting schemes and benchmarks, we open-source our fingerprinting toolbox.

item.title: Versatile Ordering Network: An Attention-based Neural Network for Ordering Across Scales and Quality Metrics
item.description: However, the optimization problems related to ordering are often difficult to solve (e. g., TSP is NP-complete), and developing specialized optimization algorithms is costly.

item.title: Subspace Implicit Neural Representations for Real-Time Cardiac Cine MR Imaging
item.description: Conventional cardiac cine MRI methods rely on retrospective gating, which limits temporal resolution and the ability to capture continuous cardiac dynamics, particularly in patients with arrhythmias and beat-to-beat variations.

item.title: SnakModel: Lessons Learned from Training an Open Danish Large Language Model
item.description: We present SnakModel, a Danish large language model (LLM) based on Llama2-7B, which we continuously pre-train on 13. 6B Danish words, and further tune on 3. 7M Danish instructions.

item.title: Faster Vision Mamba is Rebuilt in Minutes via Merged Token Re-training
item.description: Re-training the token-reduced model enhances the performance of Mamba, by effectively rebuilding the key knowledge.

item.title: ChatDiT: A Training-Free Baseline for Task-Agnostic Free-Form Chatting with Diffusion Transformers
item.description: Building upon this foundation, we present ChatDiT, a zero-shot, general-purpose, and interactive visual generation framework that leverages pretrained diffusion transformers in their original form, requiring no additional tuning, adapters, or modifications.

item.title: Harnessing Event Sensory Data for Error Pattern Prediction in Vehicles: A Language Model Approach
item.description: In this paper, we draw an analogy between processing natural languages and processing multivariate event streams from vehicles in order to predict $\textit{when}$ and $\textit{what}$ error pattern is most likely to occur in the future for a given car.

item.title: DriveTester: A Unified Platform for Simulation-Based Autonomous Driving Testing
item.description: However, one of the key challenges in ADS testing is the complexity of preparing and configuring simulation environments, particularly in terms of compatibility and stability between the simulator and the ADS.

item.title: Evaluating Zero-Shot Multilingual Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis with Large Language Models
item.description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA), a sequence labeling task, has attracted increasing attention in multilingual contexts.

item.title: Label Errors in the Tobacco3482 Dataset
item.description: Tobacco3482 is a widely used document classification benchmark dataset.

item.title: Assessing the Limitations of Large Language Models in Clinical Fact Decomposition
item.description: Verifying factual claims is critical for using large language models (LLMs) in healthcare.

item.title: CREST: An Efficient Conjointly-trained Spike-driven Framework for Event-based Object Detection Exploiting Spatiotemporal Dynamics
item.description: Event-based cameras feature high temporal resolution, wide dynamic range, and low power consumption, which is ideal for high-speed and low-light object detection.

item.title: AIR-Bench: Automated Heterogeneous Information Retrieval Benchmark
item.description: The testing data in AIR-Bench is generated with respect to diverse tasks, domains and languages.

item.title: Distribution-Free Uncertainty Quantification in Mechanical Ventilation Treatment: A Conformal Deep Q-Learning Framework
item.description: Mechanical Ventilation (MV) is a critical life-support intervention in intensive care units (ICUs).

item.title: RCTrans: Radar-Camera Transformer via Radar Densifier and Sequential Decoder for 3D Object Detection
item.description: In radar-camera 3D object detection, the radar point clouds are sparse and noisy, which causes difficulties in fusing camera and radar modalities.

item.title: A Two-Fold Patch Selection Approach for Improved 360-Degree Image Quality Assessment
item.description: This article presents a novel approach to improving the accuracy of 360-degree perceptual image quality assessment (IQA) through a two-fold patch selection process.

item.title: NLSR: Neuron-Level Safety Realignment of Large Language Models Against Harmful Fine-Tuning
item.description: The core of our framework is first to construct a safety reference model from an initially aligned model to amplify safety-related features in neurons.

item.title: Algorithmic Fidelity of Large Language Models in Generating Synthetic German Public Opinions: A Case Study
item.description: In recent research, large language models (LLMs) have been increasingly used to investigate public opinions.

item.title: ClustEm4Ano: Clustering Text Embeddings of Nominal Textual Attributes for Microdata Anonymization
item.description: This work introduces ClustEm4Ano, an anonymization pipeline that can be used for generalization and suppression-based anonymization of nominal textual tabular data.
